Final Narrative: Employee was operating a yard tractor, backing up a container; it jack-knifed and threw the operator off of the vehicle.

Employer: Schofield Barracks-Defense Commissary Agency DeCA West, Pacific Area
Final Narrative: An employee was slicing meat using a band saw when the movable platform on which the meat was placed stalled.  With his right hand on top of the meat, the employee used his right side hip to apply more force on the moving platform to push the meat toward the operating band saw. He was wearing cotton gloves at the time of the incident. The right-hand cotton glove became caught between the meat and the band saw, which consequently dragged his right ring finger toward the point of operation. His finger was amputated.
EventTitle: Caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning

Final Narrative: Two employees were lowering a part from a mast of a ship. As the employees were lowering the part with a pulley and a tagline, the part got caught in something. The injured employee pulled hard on the tagline, cutting the line and the part fell on his right index finger resulting in amputation of the fingertip.
EventTitle: Struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part
